task.title: Adding an Index to your XML Document
task.shortdesc: Once you have created your XML document and have added XML ids to your paragraph and div tags, you can add an index of terms at the bottom of your page.

step.cmd: Open up a new div at the end of your XML file; add a ‘type’ attribute called ‘index’.
Under the <div> tag add a <list> tag.
step.info: DToC expects the index to have a particular structure: list > item > ref. Essentially, what you are creating is an indexed list; the TEI tags mentioned above allow you to structure the list’s hierarchy.

step.cmd: Within the <list> tag add the <item> tag. Each <item> tag wraps around each index entry (it’s content is the index term).
Add a <ref> tag to the items in the list.
step.info: The <ref> tag has a target attribute, whose value is a space separated list of paragraph XML IDs. The <ref> tag references the paragraph in the body text.

step.cmd: Begin to add your index terms between the item/ref tags. The index contain terms for all the sections (or chapters) of your document.
step.info: The index can be simple or complex depending on your document and/or the effort that you put in to it. For example, the sections below detail how you can cross reference the index or add sub terms within an index theme.

step.cmd: Once you have added all the index terms for your documents begin to note down what paragraph(s) that each index term is located.
Add the XML ids (from the paragraph(s) or other tags) in the target attribute of the <ref> tag. If there are multiple XML ids related to the index term, separate these with a space.

step.info: Once you have uploaded your document to the Dynamic table of contexts it will look like this:

example.p: The index term “Sherlock” is located in four of the paragraphs of the document.

Record/Note the paragraphs that contain the index term. In this case, the index term is located in the third, fourth, fifth, and sixth paragraphs. These paragraphs are in a small document and have been assigned their own XML ids by the author/creator.
Within the ref tag add the “target” attribute. Then add the paragraph XML ids within the target quotation marks. If there are multiple paragraphs that contain this keyword separate them with a space.
